meanings.definition: Constructed with horizontal beams or lintels.
meanings.sent1: The trabeate roof of the house provided a sturdy support.
meanings.sent2: The ancient temple featured a trabeate design with horizontal beams.
meanings.sent3: The trabeate architecture made the building look very organized.
meanings.sent4: Her trabeate thinking style helped her approach problems logically.
meanings.sent5: The trabeate structure stood out for its simplicity and strength.

meanings.definition: Having a horizontal beam or lintel.
meanings.sent1: The trabeate doorway added a classic touch to the room.
meanings.sent2: The trabeate bridge spanned the river elegantly.
meanings.sent3: The trabeate design of the fence made it easy to climb over.
meanings.sent4: His trabeate mindset kept him focused on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The trabeate architecture showcased the beauty of simplicity.

meanings.definition: A structure with horizontal beams or lintels.
meanings.sent1: The old barn was a trabeate with its wooden beams.
meanings.sent2: The trabeate in the garden provided a shaded area for relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The trabeate in the park was a popular spot for picnics.
meanings.sent4: The trabeate of the bridge made it a sturdy crossing over the river.
meanings.sent5: The trabeate of the gazebo created a charming outdoor space.
